docs.snippet: A Dutch citizen charged with insulting religion in Myanmar for allegedly unplugging an amplifier blasting a late-night Buddhist sermon near his hotel is to appear in court, local officials said Friday.

headline.print_headline: Dutch Man Due in Myanmar Court on Insulting Religion Charge
headline.main: Dutch Man Due in Myanmar Court on Insulting Religion Charge

docs.snippet: There were two Donald J. Trumps at the debate in Las Vegas: The presidential candidate, and the possible future media mogul.

headline.print_headline: Was That a Presidential Debate or a Pitch for an Edgy Trump Channel?
headline.main: Was That a Presidential Debate or a Pitch for Trump TV?

docs.abstract: James Poniewozik Critic's Notebook bemoans Donald Trump's showman-like attitude during third and final presidential debate; holds Trump seemed to be using spotlight to promote his brand and possible future television network rather than to further his campaign.

docs.snippet: Photos from Greece, Turkey, Ivory Coast and Ukraine.
docs.abstract: Photos from Greece, Turkey, Ivory Coast and Ukraine.

docs.snippet: The radio host had been facing charges over her reporting on demonstrations against the 1,170-mile pipeline in North Dakota in September, her lawyer said.

headline.main: Judge Rejects Riot Charge Against Amy Goodman of ‘Democracy Now’ Over Pipeline Protest

docs.snippet: Actress Shailene Woodley pleaded not guilty on Wednesday to charges stemming from her high-profile arrest with 27 other people while protesting construction of the Dakota Access pipeline, court documents show.

headline.print_headline: Actress Shailene Woodley Pleads Not Guilty in Pipeline Protest
headline.main: Actress Shailene Woodley Pleads Not Guilty in Pipeline Protest

docs.snippet: The band members on the “Purple Rain” album will take part, as will others who played with Prince early in his career, in two shows in Minneapolis.

headline.print_headline: A ‘Purple Rain’ Reunion Is Set to Honor Prince
headline.main: The Revolution: A ‘Purple Rain’ Reunion in Prince’s Honor

docs.snippet: A forum predicts that the luxury industry will be faced with a precarious balancing act on multiple fronts in 2017.

headline.main: What Lies Ahead for Luxury in 2017

docs.snippet: Malaysia on Wednesday detained a ruling party official over an alleged clash with supporters of a democracy group and a threat to spark race riots, as tension mounts ahead of a rally planned for next month to demand that the prime minister resign.

headline.print_headline: Malaysia Detains Ruling Party Official Over Race Riot Threat
headline.main: Malaysia Detains Ruling Party Official Over Race Riot Threat

docs.snippet: Wyatt Gillette, who had a disease affecting his brain, immune system and skin, received the rare title from his father’s colleagues in California on Saturday, then died on Sunday.

headline.main: Ill Boy, 7, Dies a Day After Being Made Honorary Marine

docs.snippet: The departure of Adam Bain and reshuffling of his duties and aides are part of a significant shake-up under Jack Dorsey, who became C.E.O. last year.

headline.print_headline: Shake-Up at Twitter as Chief Operating Officer Announces His Departure
headline.main: Twitter’s Chief Operating Officer to Step Down
